** Brokerage Jefferies cuts PT on British industrial software provider Aveva Group AVV.L and downgrades stock to "hold" from "buy" after co posted lower H1 operating cash flow

** Cuts stock PT to 3,700p from 4,600p

** Jefferies says Aveva's contracts with its customers are written with no cancellation clauses, which have led to a "persistence of weak cash flow"

** The brokerage says as Aveva's newly acquired company OSIsoft moves to a subscription in the second half of 2022, the cash flow dynamic will remain a "topical" issue

** Jefferies says it remains concerned about the mismatch between the revenue and cash flow of the co

** "The journey to FY22 remains uncertain with volatile 3Q and 4Q comps obscuring the 2H22 outlook," Jefferies says (Full Story)

** Co posted H1 cash outflow of 14.4 mln pounds ($19.25 mln) as compared with a cash inflow of 23.7 million pounds, as reported a year ago

** Up to Thursday's close, stock up 5.7% YTD


($1 = 0.7479 pounds)


(Reporting by Sinchita Mitra)
